fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-18770].
  {panel}

The current process for setting up a secure smtp connection is a joke.

[http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+a+Server+for+Outgoing+Mail?focusedCommentId=168002633#comment-168002633]

The process is very simular for JIRA too:

[http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+JIRA+to+Send+SMTP+Mail]

The problem with the JIRA process is that it requests the user to move jars around in the archive we give them (on top of the config problems)!

I've attached a screenshot of setting up secure smtp in TeamCity - no xml editing, no downloading certificates, it's all done from the admin screen and works first go.

This is going to become more of a problem as more people move to Google Apps, as the gmail smtp server will only allow secure connections.
fields.summary: Make configuring SMTP with SSL easier

fields.description:
I have used a custom set of colors for my personal space on confluence. I have now set my theme about 6 times in 2 days, and I can't figure out the trigger, but eventually the old colors come back and I have to reset it. Is this a known bug? 

Steps to replicate:
# Go to Space Admin > Color Scheme
# Select the Custom Color Scheme
# Click Edit on the custom color scheme
# Change desired colors.
# Click Save.
# Go to Personal Space and the colors are custom. Then some time passes?? No idea what causes this, but then the colors are no longer custom. They are the old non-custom colors.
# Go to Color Scheme again.. neither Global nor Custom are marked as selected anymore. Select Custom and return to step
fields.summary: Custom colors are reset on personal spaces

fields.description:
The ability of a user to select favourite pages is a nice feature, but not very useful as of 3.1.1. The most obvious place they appear (and it's not very obvious) is way at the bottom of the Dashboard. Nowhere else are they readily accessible.

User favourites could be so much more useful!  Why not add a dropdown menu to the header that lists them?  Or add them to a sub-menu under the user menu (not as good as user experience, however)?

Yes, we could create a plugin, but the favourities feature seems core to the product, and is relatively useless currently.

Maybe there's a straightforward way to do this now w/o the bother of a plugin or without using something as heavy as Builder?

Thank you.

/mcr
fields.summary: Add user favourites menu to header bar

fields.description:
Hi,

when I add a PDF attachment to a page, there is a different behaviour depending on the case of the file extension. The only happens when I use Mozilla Firefox, in Opera 10.1 everything works as expected.

Example:

* Attachment with file name {{attachment.pdf}} has content type {{application/pdf} - everything is fine.
* Attachment with file name {{attachment.PDF}} has content type {{text/html}}. I noticed it because the attached file has the default HTML icon instead of the normal PDF icon. Please see the attached screenshot for an example. 

Some other observations:

* This only happens with Firefox, it works with Opera.
* It only affects PDF files, MS Word files work with uppercase or lowercase extendsion.

I'm not sure if this also has an impact on attachment indexing and if the PDF file with MIME type "text/html" gets indexed correctly.

Can I configure anywhere that .PDF files should have the same MIME type as .pdf files? Or is this configured inside Confluence?

Thanks in advance and kind regards,

Stephan Vollmer
fields.summary: PDF attachments with uppercase extension have wrong content type in Firefox

fields.description:
Attachments Macro is Broken after disabled Attachment Checkout plugin.

Since both plugins (Confluence Attachment plugin (bundled) and attachment checkout plugin) have the same macro (attachments), by default confluence will disable the bundled plugin once you install (enable) the Attachment Checkout plugin. 

It will do the same thing when you disable the attachment checkout plugin (Confluence will re-enable the bundled plugin). 

However, the attachments macro stops working even though all of the modules of confluence attachment plugin are re-enabled.

Here are the steps to reproduce this problem:

1. Upload attachment checkout plugin. 
2. Disable attachment checkout plugin. 
3. Verify confluence attachment plugin is enabled. 
4. View a wiki page with attachments macro, you will receive a warning 
{code}
"unknown macro - {attachments}".
{code}

h4. Workaround

The workaround is to disable and re-enable Confluence Attachment plugin:

# Go to Administration as a Confluence system administrator
# Click on 'Plugins' in the navigation menu on the left hand side
# On the 'Manage Existing' tab, click the link to 'Show System Plugins'
# Search for 'Attachments', and find the 'Confluence Attachments Plugin'
# Click the 'Disable' button to disable the plugin
# Click the 'Enable' button to reenable the plugin.
fields.summary: Attachments Macro is Broken after disabled attachment checkout plugin due to duplicate {attachments} macro

fields.description:
The Long Story: I'm attempting to delete a space.
Your documentation states I must be in the space admin group (although I'm in confluence-administrators group already), so I created the space admin group first.
Now, I'm trying to add myself (add a user to a group) to the newly created group.
Below are your instructions:

-------------------------------------Start of your instructions from http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF29/Adding+or+Removing+Users+in+Groups
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
To add a user to a group or remove a user from a group,

Go to the user management screen for the user concerned. There are two ways to do this:
Either,
Go to the user's Profile and click the 'Administer User' link on the user's profile screen. (This link is available in Confluence 2.8.2 and later.)
Or,
Go to the Confluence 'Administration Console'. To do this:
Open the 'Browse' menu and select 'Confluence Admin'. The 'Administration Console' view will open.
Select 'Manage Users' in the left-hand panel.
All members of the Confluence-Users group are listed in alphabetical order, by first name. To find a user, you can either browse through the pages or do a search on the user's 'mail ID' or the group to which they belong.
Click the user link.
Now you should be able to see the user's current details and links allowing you to edit them. 

Click 'Edit Groups'. This will display two lists of groups:
'Not a member of groups' — All groups to which the user does not belong. To add the user to a group, select a group and click 'Join'. Hold the Ctrl key down and click to select more than one group. 
'Member of groups' — All groups to which the user belongs. Select a group and click 'Leave' to remove the user from the group.
 You cannot use the 'Edit Groups' option to add or remove users in external groups, as Confluence access to LDAP and JIRA groups is read only.
-------------------------------------------------------- End of your instructions-------------------------

When I go to the Manage Users and select a user, I can view their profile but there are no links or buttons to "Edit Groups" as your instructions indicate. 
See Screenshots attached.
fields.summary: "Edit Groups" button or link is not available on Manage Users>View Profile page

On EAC the following was done
1. Create a page in personal space with editing limited to owner
2. Add edit rights to second person
3. Second person move page to a new space where first person does not have edit permisions

Now first and second person can edit page but other users with edit rights in space can not. First person will not be able to adjust the rights on the page until s/he is given edit rights on space.
fields.summary: Copying a page with restrictions can cause Confluence to block edits to people with edit access

fields.description:
When {{atlassian.dev.mode}} is enabled (or {{atlassian.disable.caches}}) the system counter used in web resource URLs is randomized each time it's retrieved.

This makes it impossible to use Firebug to debug JavaScript page load issues in dev mode (which is enabled by default in the Plugin SDK) because any breakpoints set in a JavaScript file will not be hit after reloading the page when all of the JS URLs change.
fields.summary: Randomized system counter in dev.mode makes it difficult to debug JavaScript

fields.description:
This problem occurs due to the browser sending the wrong MIME type during a file upload. It appears that Windows boxes where MS Excel handles CSV files uploads CSV files with the "application/vnd.ms-excel" MIME type. It can cause the search index to be only partially built, resulting in missing pages in search results.

h3. Workaround
Stop Confluence, edit the {{confluence/WEB-INF/classes/mime.types}} file and add the following entry:
{code}
text/csv    csv
{code}
This ensures that all files with the CSV extension are mapped to the text/csv MIME type regardless of what the browser sends.

Next, run the following query against the database and then start Confluence:
{code:sql}
update attachments set contenttype='text/csv' where lower(title) like '%.csv';
{code}

To make the content in the CSV files searchable you will also need to [run a reindex|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Content+Index+Administration#ContentIndexAdministration-RebuildingtheContentIndexes].

fields.description:
Disabling the gadget plugin prevents the link icon from working as expected.  No styles or javascript are included in the popup that appears, and thus it's no longer possible to select a page from a list of search results or otherwise use the dialog to insert a link.

Steps to reproduce:

# Under the "Plugin Repository", disable the Gadget Plugin
# Add a new page or edit an existing page
# Click the Link icon
# Notice that there are no styles (i.e. no tabs for the links)
# Attempt to select a page returned in the history or the list of search results.  Neither the link nor the alias appear as expected.
fields.summary: Disabling the Gadget plugin breaks the link icon

fields.description:
The display of links in the dashboard excerpt under Recently updated doesn't display external links correctly. Dashes in URL's disapper. Screenshot attached.
Exhibits with Confluence 3.1 and 3.1.1
fields.summary: Link formatting broken in dashboard excerpt (area: recently updated)

fields.description:
Steps:
# Added an image as a thumbnail to a page.
# Clicked on the thumbnail in view mode.
# The wait indicator is displayed but the full size image is never displayed.

NOTE
I've also attached the actual image which is a jpg. Same thing happens with png images. Have not tried other formats.

This is a very annoying bug as we are considering upgrading from 2.9 to 3.1.1 and have a lot of thumbnails in our pages.
fields.summary: Full images are not rendered when they are displayed as thumbnails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-18724].
  {panel}

During the user sessions I did today, all 3 users who used the "Browse > Pages - Tree View" section expected a "Save" button after they reordered the pages.

We should do this like so:

- The page starts with two disabled "Save" and "Cancel" buttons at the top and bottom of the tree.
- When a page is moved, the buttons are enabled.
- The user has to click "Save" to confirm their moving/reordering. If the user clicks "Cancel", the structure is reverted back to what it was when the user arrived (or when they last clicked the "Save" button).
fields.summary: Browse > Pages - Tree View: Force confirmation after reordering

fields.description:
When an admin tries to see all LDAP users in the admin console or People Directory, Confluence tries to make a connection to the LDAP server for every single user it has.

This can kill Confluence with 'Too many open files' error.

This unfortunate problem is caused by CONF-12617
fields.summary: Confluence failed with too many open files when an admin tries to see all users

fields.description:
I'd like to be able to use an authenticated feed in Confluence content. Currently the rss macro does not allow feeds that require authentication

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/RSS+Feed+Macro#RSSFeedMacro-Authentication

This seems a bit redundant, considering that there is also a whitelist (in case I did have authors putting in feeds from sites I didn't want them to). Perhaps I've missed the point, but what makes an authenticated feed so different to a regular feed that it needs to be blocked by the macro?
fields.summary: Feature change request: All user to use rss macro with  feeds that require authentication

fields.description:
When Milestone 4 came out today, many of my charts and tables on the [sales engineering dashboard|https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/PS/Sales+Engineering+Dashboard] were broken.

From what I can tell, it is the future macro that is breaking them, but I'm not sure.

The SQL of the queries is fine and they actually will render in the macro browser if you preview them there.  However, they throw an error when you save the page for real.
fields.summary: Future Macro breaks rendering of Charts and SQL queries

fields.description:
Instead of this:

!Screenshot.png|thumbnail!

We should do something more like this:

!ScreenshotAdjusted.png|thumbnail!

This matches more closely with image previews that we do in the image browser.

Daniel, if you can't do this before 3.2 can you let me know and I'll get Gerry onto it?

On QA-EAC, use autocomplete to enter a link to a page called "Home".

There is no way to tell which home page you are actually linking too.

We should be able to handle cases where there are many similarly-named pages.

The tooltips should display the space name as well as the page title, like the Quick Nav menu does.

This prevents the Enter key form cancelling the dialog. This could be a usability problem for users who are actually trying to type '!!!!'.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-18691].
  {panel}

* Attach files to a page
* Edit the page
* Press [ in the RTE.

Currently, the default suggestions are the recently viewed pages.

According to the [Autocomplete Spec|https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Autocomplete+Spec], the dropdown should also display all files attached to the page.

* Add a comment to that page
* Switch to the RTE
* Use the links browser to insert a link to the attachment

The inserted link is displayed as pink. Switching to wiki markup shows it is inserted as:


{noformat}[\^example.doc|]{noformat}

fields.description:
* Attach a .doc file to a page
* Add a comment to that page
* Press ! and use autocomplete to enter the .doc file in the comment

The following markup is entered:

{noformat}{viewdoc:name=example.doc|space=SPACENAME}{noformat}



On saving, this gives the error:


{noformat}viewdoc: The viewfile macro is unable to locate the attachment "example.doc" on this page {noformat}

* Add a page
* Upload a .doc file to the page
* Use autocomplete to select the .doc file

The following markup is entered:

{noformat}{viewdoc:page=|name=example.doc} {noformat}

Saving the page will then give error:

{noformat}viewdoc: The viewfile macro is unable to locate the page "" in space "SPACENAME" {noformat}

Increasing the attachment size limitation resolves the issue. Perhaps, the error message displayed should indicate a more accurate description of the issue.

fields.description:
* Type [ or ! in the RTE to produce the dropdown
* Click on the header "Link suggestions" or "Image suggestions"


The dialog is closed, and the text remains in the editor. This is the same behaviour as the Escape key. 

I would not expect a click within the menu to cancel it. It should either do nothing at all, or it should open up the link/image browser.
fields.summary: Autocomplete: Heading rows should not cancel dialog when clicked
Autocomplete fails to process empty result with undefined property error

fields.description:
The new links dialog is great but it's a regression from the old links dialog when it comes to web page linking - At least half of the linking I do on EAC is to other web pages outside of Confluence but you've added an extra step for people who want to link to web pages.

For example:
* I select the text I want to add the link to and then hit CTRL+K to launch the dialog.
* With the new dialog I have to take my hands off the keyboard, grab the mouse and select "web link" before typing/pasting in the URL.

I would like to be able to paste the URL into the Search dialog and have it know that I'm pasting a web page.
fields.summary: Ability to paste a web URL (i.e. 'http://...') into the Search dialog and have it actually work

fields.description:
It's way too big. it takes up 80% of the vertical height of my page which makes my eyes unable to see the link text at the bottom. I've watched a couple users try the image browser and have the same problem of not seeing the options along the bottom.

The problem can be easily mitigated by reducing the height by 35-40%. This would also make the hints at the bottom more visible to users.
fields.summary: Reduce the vertical height of the new links dialog

fields.description:
For keyboard users, the following use case would be really handy:

* Type in RTE
* Use Ctrl+K to open the links browser
* Use Up/Down to select the tab required
* Either:
** Type text into the active field in the selected tab
** Press left/right to move from the tab selection to the list of results

Currently, the only way to select different tabs is to use the mouse.
fields.summary: Links Browser: Pressing up/down keys should navigate through the different tabs

fields.description: In your documentation for downloading you have the user guide and admin guide in pdf format only.  Your complete documentation is in xml format.  I would just like to post the user guide in a space for my users.  It would be nice if just the user guide could be downloaded in an xml format.
fields.summary: Create user guide in xml format for downloading

fields.description:
I've done a bit of research all documented in https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AMPS-237

During development, passing through appropriate directories with the {{plugin.resource.directories}} property signals to the plugin framework that changed resources can be read directly from the filesystem.  This allows developers to change things like velocity templates and simply refreshing the page.

In Jira, this works great, in confluence, not at all.

From what I can see in the code, the rendering pipeline does not request the resource in the manner the plugin framework expects i.e. {{Plugin.getResource() or Plugin.getResourceAsStream()}}.  At no point during debugging did I find that any of the theme plugin templates or decorators were accessed through this.  So it appears that it may not be just a caching issue for development, but that the rendering code is going around the plugin framework to access the resource (just speculation on my part).

I mark this bug as critical, because tweaking html in trivial ways in a velocity template only to require a re-build/re-deploy is still painful.  Thank you for dynamic plugins, but it could still be easily better.

Again, Jira already works this way, it appears that Confluence is lagging behind on this issue.
fields.summary: The rendering pipeline does not respect the AlternativeDirectoryResourceLoader for velocity templates and decorators derived from plugins

Each time I do this the wiki markup shows more px's at the Image macros:

[!_Images^btn_examples.png|width=220pxpxpxpxpxpxpxpx!|Examples]\\
[!_Images^btn_examples.png|width=220pxpxpxpxpxpxpxpxpxpxpxpxpxpxpxpx!|Examples]\\
[!_Images^btn_tutorial.png|width=220pxpxpxpxpxpxpxpxpxpxpxpxpxpxpxpxpxpxpxpxpxpxpxpxpxpxpxpxpxpxpxpx!|Tutorial]\\

It may be an issue with Firefox 3.6 , I don't see the issue with IE.
fields.summary: Problem with Firefox 3.6 and Rich Text Editor - image width "px" is repeated
